attributes.trait_type: medium red onion, very thinly sliced
apple cider vinegar or additional white vinegar

attributes.value:
Pack the onions into a 1-pint mason jar or similar heat-safe vessel. Place the jar in the sink, to catch any splashes of hot vinegar later.
In a small saucepan, combine the water, both vinegars, maple syrup, salt, and pepper flakes. Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer over medium heat, then carefully pour the mixture into the jar over the onions.
Use a butter knife or spoon to press the onions down into the vinegar and pop any air bubbles in the jar. Let the pickled onions cool to room temperature (about 20 to 30 minutes), at which point they should be sufficiently pickled for serving.

Cover and refrigerate leftover pickled onions for later. Quick-pickled onions are best consumed within three days, but they keep for 2 to 3 weeks in the refrigerator.

attributes.trait_type: frozen or fresh cut green beans

attributes.value:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a casserole dish.

Lay out a half strip of bacon. Place a small bunch of green beans (6 or 7) onto the strip of bacon and roll up into a bundle. Place the bundle into the casserole dish, seam side down. Repeat with remaining bacon strips and green beans. Sprinkle with brown sugar, salt, and pepper.

Bake in the preheated oven until browned and heated through, about 20 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Break the cauliflower into florets and pulse in a food processor until fine. Steam in a steamer basket and drain well. (I like to put it on a towel to get all the moisture out.) Let cool.
In a bowl, combine the cauliflower with the mozzarella, Parmesan, oregano, salt, garlic powder and eggs. Transfer to the center of the baking sheet and spread into a circle, resembling a pizza crust. Bake for 20 minutes.
Add desired toppings and bake an additional 10 minutes.

Instructions:

Prepare the Peppers:

Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Slice the tops off the mini peppers and remove the seeds.

Make the Filling:

In a bowl, combine the cream cheese, cheddar cheese, feta cheese, chopped parsley, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix until well combined.

Stuff the Peppers:

Use a spoon or a piping bag to fill each mini pepper with the cheese mixture.
Bake:

Place the stuffed peppers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

Drizzle with a little olive oil.

Bake for 15-20 minutes, until the peppers are tender and the cheese is bubbly and golden.

Serve:

Let cool slightly before serving. Arrange on a platter and garnish with additional parsley if desired.

Instructions:
Prepare the Shrimp:

Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.
Add the lemon halves and Old Bay seasoning.
Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes, until the shrimp are pink and opaque.
Drain and transfer the shrimp to a bowl of ice water to cool quickly. Drain again.

Make the Cocktail Sauce:

In a bowl, combine the ketchup, horseradish, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, and salt. Mix well.

Assemble the Platter:

Arrange the shrimp on a large platter over a bed of ice.
Garnish with fresh lemon wedges.
Serve with the cocktail sauce in a small bowl on the side.

Instructions:

Mix the Alcohols:

In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, white rum, gin, tequila, and triple sec.

Add the Juices:

Add the pineapple juice, orange juice, lime juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.

Shake:

Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled.

Serve:

Fill a highball or hurricane glass with ice.
Strain the mixture into the glass.
Top off with a splash of cola.

Garnish:

Instructions:

Cook the Aromatics:

Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger, and cook for another minute.

Add the Spices:

Stir in the curry powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, and cayenne pepper (if using).
Cook for another 2 minutes, stirring constantly.

Add the Lentils and Liquids:

Add the rinsed lentils, diced tomatoes (with their juice), coconut milk, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for about 30-35 minutes, or until the lentils are tender and the sauce has thickened.

Season and Serve:


Season with salt and pepper to taste.

attributes.trait_type: young green jackfruit in water or brine, drained and rinsed
shredded cabbage, sliced avocado, chopped cilantro, lime wedges

attributes.value:
Instructions:

Prepare the Jackfruit:

Cut the jackfruit into smaller pieces, removing any seeds.
Use your fingers or a fork to shred the jackfruit into a pulled-pork-like texture.

Cook the Onion and Garlic:

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute.

Add the Jackfruit and Spices:

Stir in the shredded jackfruit, smoked paprika, ground cumin, ground black pepper, and salt.
Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the jackfruit starts to brown.

Add the BBQ Sauce:

Pour in the BBQ sauce and stir to coat the jackfruit evenly.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for another 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.

Assemble the Tacos:

Warm the tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave.
Fill each tortilla with the BBQ jackfruit.
Top with shredded cabbage, sliced avocado, chopped cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice.

Instructions:

Prepare the Cabbage:

Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Carefully remove the core from the cabbage and place the head in the boiling water.
Boil for a few minutes until the outer leaves become pliable and can be easily peeled off.
Remove the leaves and repeat until you have about 12-15 large leaves.
Trim the thick vein from the center of each leaf to make them easier to roll.

Prepare the Filling:

In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, ground beef, uncooked rice, chopped onion, minced garlic, egg, paprika, salt, black pepper, and caraway seeds (if using).
Mix well until all ingredients are thoroughly combined.

Stuff the Cabbage Leaves:

Place about 2 tablespoons of the filling in the center of each cabbage leaf.
Fold the sides over the filling and roll up the leaf, tucking in the sides to secure the filling.

Assemble the Dish:

In a large pot or Dutch oven, spread half of the sauerkraut on the bottom.
Arrange the stuffed cabbage rolls on top of the sauerkraut.
Add the remaining sauerkraut over the rolls.
Pour the tomato juice or crushed tomatoes and beef broth over the top.
Add the bay leaf and chopped bacon.

Cook:

Bring the pot to a simmer over medium heat.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 2 hours, or until the cabbage leaves are tender and the flavors have melded.

Serve:

Remove the bay leaf before serving.
Serve the stuffed cabbage rolls hot, with a dollop of sour cream on top.

attributes.trait_type: short-grain rice, soaked overnight, rinsed, and drained
garlic, separated into cloves but not peeled

attributes.value:
Instructions:

Prepare the Cabbage:

Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Remove the core from the cabbage. Submerge the cabbage head in boiling water until the leaves soften, about 5-10 minutes. Remove leaves with tongs as they become pliable.
Place the softened leaves in an ice bath to stop the cooking process, then drain.
Trim the thick veins from the leaves.

Prepare the Filling:

In a skillet, heat the olive oil and sauté the ground meat with the spices (allspice, cumin, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, pepper) until browned. Allow to cool slightly.
Mix the sautéed meat with the drained rice and crushed garlic in a large bowl.

Stuff the Cabbage Leaves:

Place a tablespoon of the filling at the base of each cabbage leaf.
Roll the leaf tightly, folding in the sides like a burrito to encase the filling.

Assemble the Dish:

Layer the bottom of a large pot with the tougher outer cabbage leaves.
Place the stuffed cabbage rolls seam-side down in the pot, tightly packed in layers.
Scatter the unpeeled garlic cloves between the layers.
Pour the seasoned broth (and tomato puree if using) over the cabbage rolls until just covered.

Cook:

Place a heatproof plate on top of the rolls to keep them submerged.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour, until the cabbage is tender.

Serve:

Remove the plate and carefully transfer the rolls to a serving platter.
Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the rolls and serve with lemon slices and plain yogurt on the side.

attributes.trait_type: ground meat (beef, lamb, pork, or chicken)

attributes.value:
Instructions:

Prepare the Cabbage:

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the cabbage and boil for 3-5 minutes until the outer leaves soften.
Remove softened leaves carefully and repeat until all usable leaves are removed.
Trim the thick stalks from the leaves without cutting into the leaf itself.

Prepare the Filling:

In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat and sauté the chopped onion, bell pepper, and garlic until softened (about 5 minutes). Let cool.
In a large bowl, mix the cooked rice, ground meat, egg, and sautéed vegetables. Season with salt and pepper.

Stuff the Cabbage Leaves:

Place a large spoonful (about 1/2 cup) of the meat mixture on the base of each cabbage leaf.
Fold in the sides and roll up tightly.

Cook the Rolls:

In a large pot, layer the bottom with chopped cabbage and carrots.
Place the cabbage rolls seam-side down in a single layer, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and add another layer if necessary.
In a bowl, mix the tomato sauce, stock, and bay leaves, and pour over the rolls.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for about 1 hour.

Serve:

Remove the cooked rolls from the pot.
Stir the sour cream into the remaining sauce in the pot.
Serve the cabbage rolls hot, topped with the sour cream sauce and additional sour cream if desired.

Instructions:

Prepare the Cabbage:

If using fresh cabbage, blanch the leaves in boiling water for 2-3 minutes until pliable. For pickled cabbage, rinse and soak if too salty, then separate the leaves.
Trim the thick stem from each leaf to make rolling easier.

Prepare the Filling:

In a skillet, sauté the chopped onion and garlic until softened.
In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, uncooked rice, sautéed onion and garlic, thyme, oregano, paprika, black pepper, and salt. Mix well.

Stuff the Cabbage Leaves:

Place a tablespoon of the filling at the base of each cabbage leaf.
Fold in the sides and roll tightly, tucking in the ends.

Assemble the Dish:

Layer the bottom of a large pot with chopped cabbage or a few larger leaves.
Arrange the stuffed cabbage rolls on top, seam-side down. Add the chopped bacon (if using) between the layers.
Pour the tomato sauce and water or broth over the rolls to cover them.

Cook:

Cover the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours, until the cabbage is tender and the flavors have melded.

Serve:

Garnish with fresh herbs before serving. Enjoy hot, with a side of sour cream if desired.

attributes.trait_type: large head of sour cabbage or fresh cabbage

attributes.value:
Instructions:

Prepare the Cabbage:

If using fresh cabbage, core it and blanch in boiling water for 5-8 minutes until leaves are pliable. For sour cabbage, soak in cold water for at least an hour if too salty.
Carefully separate the leaves, trim the thick veins, and set aside.

Prepare the Filling:

Cook the rice until almost done and let it cool.
In a skillet, sauté the chopped onion in vegetable oil until translucent. Set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, cooked rice, sautéed onions, egg, dill, thyme, smoked paprika, salt, pepper, and chopped parsley. Mix well.

Stuff the Cabbage Leaves:

Place about 1-2 tablespoons of the filling at the base of each cabbage leaf.
Fold the sides over the filling and roll tightly, tucking in the ends.

Assemble the Dish:

In a large pot or Dutch oven, spread half of the sauerkraut on the bottom.
Arrange the stuffed cabbage rolls on top of the sauerkraut.
Add the chopped bacon, bay leaves, and peppercorns between the layers.
Cover the rolls with the remaining sauerkraut and pour the tomato juice over everything. Add water if necessary to ensure the rolls are covered.

Cook:

Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Transfer the pot to the oven and bake, uncovered, for an additional 1 hour.

Serve:

Serve hot, with a dollop of sour cream on top.

attributes.trait_type: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

attributes.value:
Position an oven rack to the middle position and preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the lasagna noodles 1 minute longer than the package directions for al dente. The pasta should be tender enough that it will roll without cracking. Drain well and rinse with cold water. Lay in a single layer on a baking sheet. 
Meanwhile, melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour and cook, stirring, until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes. Whisk in the milk, a large pinch of salt and a few grinds of pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until the sauce thickens and is the consistency of a thin gravy, 6 to 8 minutes. Allow the bechamel sauce to cool slightly.
Beat the egg in a large bowl and then stir in the ricotta, spinach, 1 1/2 cups of the mozzarella cheese, 1/2 cup of the Parmesan, 1/2 cup of the pesto, a large pinch of salt and a few grinds of pepper. Stir the remaining 1/2 cup pesto into the slightly cooled bechamel sauce. 
Brush a 13- by 9- inch baking dish with oil. Spread 1/4 cup of the pesto-bechamel sauce on to the bottom of the dish. 
Lay half of the cooked lasagna noodles on a clean work surface and spread 1/3 cup of the ricotta mixture evenly over each. Starting with a short end, roll each noodle up. As you make the rolls, transfer them to the prepared baking dish seam-side down. Repeat with the remaining noodles and ricotta mixture. Spoon the remaining pesto-bechamel sauce over the lasagna rolls and sprinkle with the remaining 1 cup mozzarella and 1/4 cup Parmesan. Cover with foil and bake until the rolls are heated through and the sauce is bubbling, about 20 minutes. Remove the foil and bake until the cheese is browned on top, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper, if using, and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Instructions: Prepare the Apples: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). Melt the butter in a large ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add the apple slices and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Make the Batter: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, flour, milk, sugar, salt, and vanilla extract until smooth. Cook the Pancake: Pour the batter over the softened apples in the skillet. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the pancake is puffed and golden brown. Serve: Dust the pancake with powdered sugar and ground cinnamon if desired. Serve warm.

attributes.trait_type: grated cheese (e.g., Gruyère, Emmental, or Cheddar)

attributes.value:
Instructions:

Prepare the Dough:

Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, and baking powder.
Cut in the cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in the grated cheese and sour cream until the dough comes together.

Shape the Biscuits:

Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to about 1/2-inch thickness.

Cut out rounds using a biscuit cutter or a glass.
Place the rounds on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake:

Brush the tops of the biscuits with the beaten egg.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.

Serve:

Serve warm or at room temperature.

Instructions: Prepare the Meat: In a large Dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove and set aside. In the same pot, sear the beef cubes until browned on all sides. Remove and set aside. Cook the Vegetables: Add the chopped onion and garlic to the pot and sauté until softened. Add the carrots and mushrooms, and cook for another 5 minutes. Combine Ingredients: Return the beef and bacon to the pot. Sprinkle the flour over the mixture and stir to coat the meat and vegetables. Pour in the red wine and beef broth, and add the tomato paste, thyme, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for 2-3 hours, or until the beef is tender. Serve: Remove the bay leaves before serving. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve with crusty bread or mashed potatoes.

Mix the first 7 ingredients. In a large nonstick skillet, heat 1 teaspoon oil over medium-high heat; stir-fry beef until browned, 1-3 minutes. Remove from pan.

Stir-fry broccoli in remaining oil until crisp-tender, 3-5 minutes. Add green onions; cook just until tender, 1-2 minutes. Stir cornstarch mixture and add to pan. Bring to a boil; cook and stir until sauce is thickened, 2-3 minutes. Add beef and heat through.

In a large skillet, cook chicken over medium heat until no longer pink, 8-10 minutes, breaking it into crumbles; drain. In the same skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add shallots and chiles; cook and stir until tender, 3-4 minutes. Add garlic; cook 1 minute longer.

Stir in the cooked chicken, lime juice, fish sauce, chili sauce, brown sugar and Sriracha. Cook and stir until heated through. Stir in cilantro and mint. Serve with rice, and lettuce leaves if desired.

boneless beef chuck steak, thinly sliced
fresh Thai basil leaves, coarsely chopped

attributes.value:
In a bowl, stir together first 7 ingredients; set aside. Cook noodles according to package directions; drain. Toss with 1 tablespoon oil; set aside.

In a large wok or skillet, heat remaining oil over high heat. Add beef in a single layer; cook until caramelized, about 30 seconds. Turn and cook 30 seconds more; remove. Add red peppers, onion and Thai chiles to wok; stir-fry until peppers are just tender and starting to brown, 2-3 minutes. Add sauce and noodles; bring to a simmer. Cook until sauce thickens and starts to coat noodles. Add beef; toss to coat. Remove from heat; add basil and chives. Serve immediately.

Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook for 10 minutes or until tender; drain. Mash potatoes; cool to room temperature.

Preheat air fryer to 375°. In a large bowl, stir together potatoes, paneer, cardamom and salt until combined. Spoon 2 tablespoons of potato mixture in lightly greased hands and flatten to 1/8 in. thick. Press a raisin and cashew in the center; bring sides up to enclose. Gently roll into a ball. Repeat with remaining potato mixture. Spritz fryer basket with cooking spray. Working in batches if needed, place balls in a single layer in basket lined with parchment. Cook until golden brown, 10-15 minutes.

Meanwhile, for the gravy, in a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker, combine tomatoes, yogurt, water, cashews, ginger garlic paste and 1 teaspoon red chili powder. Lock lid; close pressure-release valve. Adjust to pressure-cook on high for 6 minutes. Quick-release pressure. Puree mixture using an immersion blender until smooth. Strain mixture, pressing to extract as much liquid as possible; discard solids. Wipe insert clean.

Select saute setting and adjust for medium heat; add ghee. When ghee is hot, add garam masala and remaining 1 teaspoon red chili powder; cook, stirring constantly, until very fragrant, 1-2 minutes. Stir in strained tomato mixture and sugar. Simmer, uncovered, until mixture is slightly thickened, 5-8 minutes. Add fenugreek and, if desired, cream; cook 1 minute. Pour mixture over kofta.

attributes.trait_type: head cauliflower, cut into 2 or 3 pieces
small potatoes, peeled and cut into thin wedges

attributes.value:
Select saute setting on a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker. Adjust for medium heat; add oil. When oil is hot, cook and stir cumin seeds until fragrant and they start to pop. Add onion; cook until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and ginger; cook 1 minute. Add chili powder, garam masala, cumin, salt and turmeric; cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in cauliflower, potatoes and water. Press cancel.
Lock lid; close pressure-release valve. Adjust to pressure-cook on high for 3 minutes. Let pressure release naturally for 5 minutes; quick-release any remaining pressure. Sprinkle with cilantro if desired.

Select saute setting on a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker. Adjust for medium heat; add oil. When oil is hot, cook and stir onions until crisp-tender, 2-3 minutes. Add garlic and oregano; cook and stir 1 minute longer. Stir in wine. Bring to a boil; cook until liquid is reduced by half, 3-4 minutes. Press cancel.

Add potatoes, beans, mushrooms, leeks and carrots. Stir in water, tomatoes, thyme, salt and pepper. Lock lid; close pressure-release valve. Adjust to pressure-cook on high for 3 minutes. Allow pressure to release naturally for 10 minutes, then quick-release any remaining pressure. Top with basil.

name: Gingered Short Ribs with Green Rice

attributes.trait_type: sherry or additional reduced-sodium beef broth

attributes.value:
In a small bowl, whisk the first 7 ingredients until blended. Place carrots and onions in a 5-qt. slow cooker. Sprinkle ribs with salt and pepper; place over vegetables. Pour broth mixture over top.

Cook, covered, on low 8-10 hours or until meat is tender.

Just before serving, prepare rice according to package directions. Stir in green onions, cilantro, jalapenos and lime zest.

Remove ribs to a serving plate; keep warm. Transfer cooking juices to a small saucepan; skim fat. Bring juices to a boil. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water until smooth; stir into cooking juices. Return to a boil; cook and stir 2 minutes or until thickened. Serve with ribs and rice.

attributes.trait_type: diced tomatoes with chiles, such as Rotel
shredded cooked chicken (from about 1 small rotisserie chicken)
small corn tortillas, cut into quarters

attributes.value:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Brush a 9-by-13-inch casserole dish with the oil.
Stir together the diced tomatoes with chiles, chicken broth, chili powder, cumin and salt in a large bowl. Add the black beans, frozen corn, chicken, tortilla wedges and half the cheese and stir to evenly distribute and moisten all of the ingredients. Transfer to the prepared casserole dish and spread into an even layer. Loosely cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.  
Raise the oven temperature to 400 degrees F. Remove the foil and sprinkle the top with the remaining cheese. Continue to bake until the cheese is melted and just starting to brown, about 10 minutes. Top with dollops of sour cream and sprinkle with the red onion and cilantro. Serve hot.

Place flour in a large bowl; stir in boiling water until dough forms a ball. Turn onto a floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, 4-6 minutes. Place in a large bowl; cover and let rest for 30 minutes.

Divide dough into 8 portions; roll each portion into an 8-in. circle. Brush with 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil; sprinkle with 1 heaping tablespoon of green onion and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Roll into a thin cylinder (jelly-roll style); starting at one end, twist cylinder onto itself forming a coil, pinching to seal. Flatten slightly. Roll each coil to 1/8-in. thickness.

In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon canola oil. Over medium-high heat, cook 1 pancake at a time until golden brown, 2-3 minutes on each side.

Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine sauce ingredients. Serve with pancakes.
1/2 cup (more if needed to adjust consistency)

Put all ingredients into blender and blend until smooth and pourable, adjust water quantity if needed.
Use as a dressing or a sauce

Combine all ingredients in a bowl and add cubed tofu. Let marinade for 30 mins. Cook tofu and extra liquid. Create a mixture of cornstarch and water (1 tbsp cornstarch and 4-5 tbsp water) and mix well, then slowly add to tofu to thicken sauce. Add just enough of the corn starch mixture to thicken it, you probably won't need it all.
Serve tofu on rice and other roasted veggies.

Instructions:
Cook the Quinoa:

Rinse the quinoa under cold water.
In a medium saucepan, bring the quinoa and water to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender.
Fluff with a fork and let it cool.
Combine Ingredients:

In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, black beans, bell peppers, red onion, corn, avocado, and cilantro.
Make the Dressing:

In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lime juice, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Assemble the Salad:

Pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Instructions:
Assemble the Skewers:

Thread one cherry tomato, one mozzarella ball, and one basil leaf onto each skewer.
Repeat until all ingredients are used.
Season and Serve:

Drizzle the skewers with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
Arrange on a platter and serve immediately.

Instructions:
Prepare the Eggs:

Peel the hard-boiled eggs and slice them in half lengthwise.
Remove the yolks and place them in a bowl.
Make the Filling:

Mash the egg yolks with the avocado until smooth.
Stir in the lime juice, Dijon mustard, cilantro, salt, and pepper.
Fill the Eggs:

Spoon or pipe the avocado mixture back into the egg whites.
Sprinkle with paprika for garnish.
Serve chilled.

Instructions:
Make the Dip:

In a bowl, mix together the Greek yogurt, honey, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Serve:

Transfer the dip to a serving bowl.
Arrange the fresh fruit on a platter around the dip.
Serve immediately.

Instructions: Make the Dough: In a large bowl, dissolve the yeast in warm water. Let it sit for about 5 minutes until it becomes frothy. Add the flour, olive oil, sugar, and salt to the yeast mixture. Stir until the dough comes together. Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5-7 minutes, until smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size. Prepare the Pizza: Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C).Punch down the dough and divide it into two equal parts. Roll out each part on a floured surface to form two 12-inch pizza crusts. Transfer the crusts to lightly greased pizza pans or baking sheets. Assemble the Pizza: Spread the pizza sauce evenly over each crust. Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce. Sprinkle dried oregano and basil on top of the cheese. Bake: Bake the pizzas in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned. Serve: Let the pizzas cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving. Servings: 2 pizzas (12 slices total, serving 8-12 people) Luigi a'loves when people make the a'pizz for party! Everybody a'loves A'Pizz Luigi!

Instructions:

Prepare the Filling:
In a bowl, mix the softened cream cheese with the ranch seasoning mix.
Assemble the Pinwheels:
Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over each tortilla.
Sprinkle the shredded carrots, chopped bell peppers, chopped cucumber, and baby spinach leaves over the cream cheese.
Roll up each tortilla tightly and slice into 1-inch pinwheels.
Serve:
Arrange the 24 pinwheels on a platter and serve.

Instructions:

Prepare the Punch:
In a large pitcher, combine the pineapple juice, orange juice, cranberry juice, and lemon-lime soda.
Stir well to mix.
Serve:
Fill cups with ice cubes and pour the punch over the ice.
Garnish with fresh fruit slices.
